segment.source: MD Conversion - Get started with a 30-day trial of Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Get started with a 30-day trial of Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Get started with a 30-day trial of Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Get started with a 30-day trial of Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Setting up a free Microsoft Intune 30-day trial to manage your mobile devices and computers is quick and easy.
segment.target: Setting up a free Microsoft Intune 30-day trial to manage your mobile devices and computers is quick and easy.

segment.source: With just a few simple steps in the trial, you can add up to 100 users and devices, set up groups, configure compliance policies, and enroll and manage mobile devices and computers.
segment.target: With just a few simple steps in the trial, you can add up to 100 users and devices, set up groups, configure compliance policies, and enroll and manage mobile devices and computers.

segment.source: In this topic, you'll learn the basics to get an Intune trial up and running and get an overview of the service so you can evaluate Intune's features and capabilities.
segment.target: In this topic, you'll learn the basics to get an Intune trial up and running and get an overview of the service so you can evaluate Intune's features and capabilities.

segment.source: Watch this five-minute demo video to learn how easy it is to get started with a free trial of Microsoft Intune and to manage your devices:
segment.target: Watch this five-minute demo video to learn how easy it is to get started with a free trial of Microsoft Intune and to manage your devices:

segment.source: Before you begin
segment.target: Before you begin

segment.source: Before you get started with Intune, you'll need the following:
segment.target: Before you get started with Intune, you'll need the following:

segment.source: A device with a Silverlight-enabled web browser that you can use to access the websites where you'll create Intune user accounts (the Intune Account Portal) and where you manage devices, groups, and policies (the Intune administration console).
segment.target: A device with a Silverlight-enabled web browser that you can use to access the websites where you'll create Intune user accounts (the Intune Account Portal) and where you manage devices, groups, and policies (the Intune administration console).

segment.source: A second device with a web browser that you'll use to test how users will enroll and manage their devices using the company portal.
segment.target: A second device with a web browser that you'll use to test how users will enroll and manage their devices using the company portal.

segment.source: You'll also test how users find and install apps and request help from administrators.
segment.target: You'll also test how users find and install apps and request help from administrators.

segment.source: If you don't have a second device, you can use the “privacy mode” setting on the same browser that you use for administration (for example: in Internet Explorer, you can click Tools > InPrivate Browsing).
segment.target: If you don't have a second device, you can use the “privacy mode” setting on the same browser that you use for administration (for example: in Internet Explorer, you can click Tools > InPrivate Browsing).

segment.source: If you have an existing Microsoft Online Services account, you'll need the administrator credentials for that account.
segment.target: If you have an existing Microsoft Online Services account, you'll need the administrator credentials for that account.

segment.source: If you don’t have such an account, or if you want to use this Intune tenant for evaluation purposes only, you don't need these administrator credentials.
segment.target: If you don’t have such an account, or if you want to use this Intune tenant for evaluation purposes only, you don't need these administrator credentials.

segment.source: If you'll manage iOS or Windows Phone devices with the Intune trial, you'll need certificates (or keys) and accounts to retrieve those certificates (see the following table).
segment.target: If you'll manage iOS or Windows Phone devices with the Intune trial, you'll need certificates (or keys) and accounts to retrieve those certificates (see the following table).

segment.source: Android devices don't need any additional certificates.
segment.target: Android devices don't need any additional certificates.

segment.source: Platform
segment.target: Platform

segment.source: Certificate Requirements
segment.target: Certificate Requirements

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and

segment.source: No certificate is required for Windows Phone 8.1 users who install the company portal app from the Store.
segment.target: No certificate is required for Windows Phone 8.1 users who install the company portal app from the Store.

segment.source: A Symantec certificate is required for Windows Phone 8.0 or to use Intune to deploy the company portal app to Windows Phone 8.1 devices.
segment.target: A Symantec certificate is required for Windows Phone 8.0 or to use Intune to deploy the company portal app to Windows Phone 8.1 devices.

segment.source: This guidance assumes your users get the company portal app from the Store on a Windows Phone 8.1 or later device.
segment.target: This guidance assumes your users get the company portal app from the Store on a Windows Phone 8.1 or later device.

segment.source: For information about Windows Phone 8.0 support, see Set up Windows Phone management with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about Windows Phone 8.0 support, see Set up Windows Phone management with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Windows 10, , , or devices
segment.target: Windows 10, , , or devices

segment.source: There are no certificate requirements for enrolling Windows RT and Windows devices.
segment.target: There are no certificate requirements for enrolling Windows RT and Windows devices.

segment.source: Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: iOS 7.1 or later
segment.target: iOS 7.1 or later

segment.source: Get an Apple Push Notification service certificate.
segment.target: Get an Apple Push Notification service certificate.

segment.source: Request an Apple Push Notification service certificate from Apple, as described here: Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Request an Apple Push Notification service certificate from Apple, as described here: Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Step 1: Sign up or sign in to Intune
segment.target: Step 1: Sign up or sign in to Intune

segment.source: Before you sign up or sign in to Intune, you should consider the following:
segment.target: Before you sign up or sign in to Intune, you should consider the following:

segment.source: Whether your organization already has a Microsoft Online Services work or school account
segment.target: Whether your organization already has a Microsoft Online Services work or school account

segment.source: Whether you have an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement with Microsoft
segment.target: Whether you have an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement with Microsoft

segment.source: Whether you plan to use the Intune tenant after the 30-day trial
segment.target: Whether you plan to use the Intune tenant after the 30-day trial

segment.source: Sign up for a NEW account if either of the following is true:
segment.target: Sign up for a NEW account if either of the following is true:

segment.source: Sign in with your WORK or SCHOOL account if:
segment.target: Sign in with your WORK or SCHOOL account if:

segment.source: You don’t have a work or school account.
segment.target: You don’t have a work or school account.

segment.source: A work or school account is provided when you sign a volume licensing agreement with Microsoft or subscribe to Office 365.
segment.target: A work or school account is provided when you sign a volume licensing agreement with Microsoft or subscribe to Office 365.

segment.source: If your organization has not signed an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement with Microsoft (or has an Office 365 account), then you do not have a Microsoft Online Services account that you can use to sign in to Microsoft Online Services.
segment.target: If your organization has not signed an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement with Microsoft (or has an Office 365 account), then you do not have a Microsoft Online Services account that you can use to sign in to Microsoft Online Services.

segment.source: You will discard your Intune tenant after completing the 30-day trial.
segment.target: You will discard your Intune tenant after completing the 30-day trial.

segment.source: You should sign up for a new account if you are using your free trial subscription for evaluation purposes only, and you plan to redo your service setup and device provisioning after the trial.
segment.target: You should sign up for a new account if you are using your free trial subscription for evaluation purposes only, and you plan to redo your service setup and device provisioning after the trial.

segment.source: This is the recommended option if you plan to use with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: This is the recommended option if you plan to use with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: If you sign up for a new account, you cannot later use an existing work or school account to manage that account, or combine it with existing volume licensing agreements.
segment.target: If you sign up for a new account, you cannot later use an existing work or school account to manage that account, or combine it with existing volume licensing agreements.

segment.source: You have a work or school account provided with a volume licensing agreement or Office 365 subscription, and you are using this trial to evaluate .
segment.target: You have a work or school account provided with a volume licensing agreement or Office 365 subscription, and you are using this trial to evaluate .

segment.source: If you are setting up on an existing account, we recommend that you review Introduction to Microsoft Intune before continuing with these steps.
segment.target: If you are setting up on an existing account, we recommend that you review Introduction to Microsoft Intune before continuing with these steps.

segment.source: Sign up or sign in to Intune
segment.target: Sign up or sign in to Intune

segment.source: First, click here to visit the Intune Sign up page.
segment.target: First, click here to visit the Intune Sign up page.

segment.source: On the Sign up page, you have two options:
segment.target: On the Sign up page, you have two options:

segment.source: Subscribe using your Microsoft Online Services work or school account: Click Sign in if you already have a work or school account, and you want to use the same account to subscribe to both services.
segment.target: Subscribe using your Microsoft Online Services work or school account: Click Sign in if you already have a work or school account, and you want to use the same account to subscribe to both services.

segment.source: When you use the same account for multiple services, those services use the same Azure AD infrastructure and are tenants of Azure AD.
segment.target: When you use the same account for multiple services, those services use the same Azure AD infrastructure and are tenants of Azure AD.

segment.source: Azure AD provides the core directory and identity management capabilities for Microsoft cloud services.
segment.target: Azure AD provides the core directory and identity management capabilities for Microsoft cloud services.

segment.source: Subscribe to Intune only: If you do not yet subscribe to a cloud service, complete the form on the sign-up page to subscribe to .
segment.target: Subscribe to Intune only: If you do not yet subscribe to a cloud service, complete the form on the sign-up page to subscribe to .

segment.source: By default, the domain name is associated with your subscription and user accounts that you add to .
segment.target: By default, the domain name is associated with your subscription and user accounts that you add to .

segment.source: After you subscribe, you can add and use a custom domain name that you already own, or continue to use the free onmicrosoft.com domain.
segment.target: After you subscribe, you can add and use a custom domain name that you already own, or continue to use the free onmicrosoft.com domain.

segment.source: After you complete the sign-up form and accept the Microsoft Online Subscription Agreement, you're automatically signed in to the with the tenant administrator account.
segment.target: After you complete the sign-up form and accept the Microsoft Online Subscription Agreement, you're automatically signed in to the with the tenant administrator account.

segment.source: An email message that contains your account information is also sent to the email address that you provided during sign-up.
segment.target: An email message that contains your account information is also sent to the email address that you provided during sign-up.

segment.source: This email confirms that your subscription is active.
segment.target: This email confirms that your subscription is active.

segment.source: Step 2: Add users to Intune
segment.target: Step 2: Add users to Intune

segment.source: Now that you have set up your account, you'll use either the New Users wizard to add individual user accounts to , or the Bulk add users wizard to add users in bulk (see the instructions in this section).
segment.target: Now that you have set up your account, you'll use either the New Users wizard to add individual user accounts to , or the Bulk add users wizard to add users in bulk (see the instructions in this section).

segment.source: Before you get started, it's important that you understand how Intune handles administrator accounts.
segment.target: Before you get started, it's important that you understand how Intune handles administrator accounts.

segment.source: A tenant administrator uses the account portal to add users to the Microsoft Intune Users Group.
segment.target: A tenant administrator uses the account portal to add users to the Microsoft Intune Users Group.

segment.source: Adding users to the Users Group assigns Intune subscription licenses to users and is also how you make those users to show up in the Microsoft Intune administration console.
segment.target: Adding users to the Users Group assigns Intune subscription licenses to users and is also how you make those users to show up in the Microsoft Intune administration console.

segment.source: Administrator accounts for Intune aren't created in the account portal, as regular user accounts are.
segment.target: Administrator accounts for Intune aren't created in the account portal, as regular user accounts are.

segment.source: Instead, you assign either read-only access or full access administrative rights to users by using the administration console in the Administration workspace under Administration Management.
segment.target: Instead, you assign either read-only access or full access administrative rights to users by using the administration console in the Administration workspace under Administration Management.

segment.source: Service administrators that are assigned read-only access cannot change Intune settings, but they can view data and run reports.
segment.target: Service administrators that are assigned read-only access cannot change Intune settings, but they can view data and run reports.

segment.source: Service administrators with full access have all available administrative rights.
segment.target: Service administrators with full access have all available administrative rights.

segment.source: You can view tenant administrator information by using the Intune administration console, but you cannot create tenant administrators there.
segment.target: You can view tenant administrator information by using the Intune administration console, but you cannot create tenant administrators there.

segment.source: By default, the subscription owner becomes a tenant administrator for your Microsoft Intune service and has full access to both the Intune account portal and the Intune administration console.
segment.target: By default, the subscription owner becomes a tenant administrator for your Microsoft Intune service and has full access to both the Intune account portal and the Intune administration console.

segment.source: We recommend that you create a least one extra tenant administrator account by using the account portal to help delegate tasks and to ensure that you don’t get locked out of your Intune service administrator account if you forget your password.
segment.target: We recommend that you create a least one extra tenant administrator account by using the account portal to help delegate tasks and to ensure that you don’t get locked out of your Intune service administrator account if you forget your password.

segment.source: Add individual user accounts
segment.target: Add individual user accounts

segment.source: Use the following steps to create additional user accounts in your trial tenant.
segment.target: Use the following steps to create additional user accounts in your trial tenant.

segment.source: Remember, each user account that you add counts as one of the 100 licenses that you get as part of your free trial.
segment.target: Remember, each user account that you add counts as one of the 100 licenses that you get as part of your free trial.

segment.source: In the Office 365 admin center, click Add Users > New> User to start the New users wizard.
segment.target: In the Office 365 admin center, click Add Users > New> User to start the New users wizard.

segment.source: On the Details page, complete the required fields.
segment.target: On the Details page, complete the required fields.

segment.source: On the Settings page, set the location for the user.
segment.target: On the Settings page, set the location for the user.

segment.source: On the Group page, click Next to accept the default and assign a license for to the user’s account.
segment.target: On the Group page, click Next to accept the default and assign a license for to the user’s account.

segment.source: On the Email page, specify up to five email addresses that will receive notification of the user name and temporary password for the account.
segment.target: On the Email page, specify up to five email addresses that will receive notification of the user name and temporary password for the account.

segment.source: Separate multiple email addresses by semicolons (;).
segment.target: Separate multiple email addresses by semicolons (;).

segment.source: When you're done, click Create to add the user to your subscription.
segment.target: When you're done, click Create to add the user to your subscription.

segment.source: On the Results page, you can view the new account name and its temporary password.
segment.target: On the Results page, you can view the new account name and its temporary password.

segment.source: automatically creates the temporary password.
segment.target: automatically creates the temporary password.

segment.source: When the new user appears in the Users node of the account portal, verify that the new user was created successfully:
segment.target: When the new user appears in the Users node of the account portal, verify that the new user was created successfully:

segment.source: In the Intune administration console, click Admin > Company Portal, and then scroll to the bottom of the screen.
segment.target: In the Intune administration console, click Admin > Company Portal, and then scroll to the bottom of the screen.

segment.source: Copy the URL shown under Intune company portal.
segment.target: Copy the URL shown under Intune company portal.

segment.source: Open a new browser window in “privacy mode” (in Internet Explorer, click Tools > InPrivate Browsing), or open a new browser window on a different device, and then navigate to the URL that you copied in the previous step.
segment.target: Open a new browser window in “privacy mode” (in Internet Explorer, click Tools > InPrivate Browsing), or open a new browser window on a different device, and then navigate to the URL that you copied in the previous step.

segment.source: When users sign in for the first time, they must provide a new password for the account.
segment.target: When users sign in for the first time, they must provide a new password for the account.

segment.source: Add users in bulk
segment.target: Add users in bulk

segment.source: To add users in bulk to Intune, use the Bulk add users wizard to upload a comma-separated values (CSV) file that contains your user data.
segment.target: To add users in bulk to Intune, use the Bulk add users wizard to upload a comma-separated values (CSV) file that contains your user data.

segment.source: Links in the wizard enable you to download a blank template and sample CSV file.
segment.target: Links in the wizard enable you to download a blank template and sample CSV file.

segment.source: The first row of your CSV file must contain, in the correct order, each of the user data column labels.
segment.target: The first row of your CSV file must contain, in the correct order, each of the user data column labels.

segment.source: Then, for each user in the CSV file, you must include the user name (like bob@contoso.com) and a display name (like Bob Kelly).
segment.target: Then, for each user in the CSV file, you must include the user name (like bob@contoso.com) and a display name (like Bob Kelly).

segment.source: In the Office 365 admin center, click Users > New.
segment.target: In the Office 365 admin center, click Users > New.

segment.source: Click Bulk add to start the Bulk add users wizard.
segment.target: Click Bulk add to start the Bulk add users wizard.

segment.source: On the Select file page, click Browse to specify and load an existing CSV file from your computer.
segment.target: On the Select file page, click Browse to specify and load an existing CSV file from your computer.

segment.source: You can also download a sample CSV file or blank template file by using the links in the wizard.
segment.target: You can also download a sample CSV file or blank template file by using the links in the wizard.

segment.source: On the Verification page, review the results, and then click View for more details.
segment.target: On the Verification page, review the results, and then click View for more details.

segment.source: On the Settings page, confirm that the sign-in status is Allowed, and set the location.
segment.target: On the Settings page, confirm that the sign-in status is Allowed, and set the location.

segment.source: These settings apply to all user accounts added by the CSV file.
segment.target: These settings apply to all user accounts added by the CSV file.

segment.source: On the Group page, click Next to accept the default and assign a license for to all user accounts added by the CSV file.
segment.target: On the Group page, click Next to accept the default and assign a license for to all user accounts added by the CSV file.

segment.source: By default, the check box is selected, which assigns a license for to each account.
segment.target: By default, the check box is selected, which assigns a license for to each account.

segment.source: On the Email page, specify up to five email addresses to receive notification of the user names and temporary passwords that creates for each account.
segment.target: On the Email page, specify up to five email addresses to receive notification of the user names and temporary passwords that creates for each account.

segment.source: Separate multiple email addresses with semicolons (;).
segment.target: Separate multiple email addresses with semicolons (;).

segment.source: When ready, click Create to add the users to your subscription.
segment.target: When ready, click Create to add the users to your subscription.

segment.source: On the Results page, you can view the account names and temporary password for each user account.
segment.target: On the Results page, you can view the account names and temporary password for each user account.

segment.source: Each user account that you added by importing it now appears in the Users node of the account portal.
segment.target: Each user account that you added by importing it now appears in the Users node of the account portal.

segment.source: When new users sign in for the first time, they must specify a new password for their user account.
segment.target: When new users sign in for the first time, they must specify a new password for their user account.

segment.source: Step 3: Create groups to organize users and devices
segment.target: Step 3: Create groups to organize users and devices

segment.source: Groups in give you great flexibility for managing your devices and users.
segment.target: Groups in give you great flexibility for managing your devices and users.

segment.source: You can set up groups to suit your organizational needs (for example, by geographic location, department, or hardware characteristics) and use them to perform a variety of administrative tasks at scale, from setting policies for a set of users to deploying applications to a set of devices.
segment.target: You can set up groups to suit your organizational needs (for example, by geographic location, department, or hardware characteristics) and use them to perform a variety of administrative tasks at scale, from setting policies for a set of users to deploying applications to a set of devices.

segment.source: Create a device group
segment.target: Create a device group

segment.source: Use device groups to deploy software and updates, and configure Microsoft Intune Agent Settings and Windows Firewall Settings policies.
segment.target: Use device groups to deploy software and updates, and configure Microsoft Intune Agent Settings and Windows Firewall Settings policies.

segment.source: For example, set up a "My Trial Devices" group using the following steps:
segment.target: For example, set up a "My Trial Devices" group using the following steps:

segment.source: In the Intune administration console, click Groups > Overview > Create Group.
segment.target: In the Intune administration console, click Groups > Overview > Create Group.

segment.source: For the Group name, type “My Trial Devices” and, from the parent group list, select All Devices, and then click Next.
segment.target: For the Group name, type “My Trial Devices” and, from the parent group list, select All Devices, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Define Membership Criteria page, select All devices to indicate that the group includes both mobile devices and computers.
segment.target: On the Define Membership Criteria page, select All devices to indicate that the group includes both mobile devices and computers.

segment.source: On the Define Direct Membership page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Define Direct Membership page, click Next.

segment.source: If you previously created a group that does not include all devices, and you wanted to add specific devices to your new group, you can do that here.
segment.target: If you previously created a group that does not include all devices, and you wanted to add specific devices to your new group, you can do that here.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the actions that will be taken, and then click Finish.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the actions that will be taken, and then click Finish.

segment.source: You can find the newly created group in the Groups list, in the Groups workspace under All Devices.
segment.target: You can find the newly created group in the Groups list, in the Groups workspace under All Devices.

segment.source: From here, you can also edit or delete the group.
segment.target: From here, you can also edit or delete the group.

segment.source: Create a user group
segment.target: Create a user group

segment.source: Use user groups to deploy software and device policies.
segment.target: Use user groups to deploy software and device policies.

segment.source: For example, set up a "My Trial Users" group using the following steps:
segment.target: For example, set up a "My Trial Users" group using the following steps:

segment.source: In the Intune administration console, click Groups > Overview > Create Group.
segment.target: In the Intune administration console, click Groups > Overview > Create Group.

segment.source: For the Group name, type “My Trial Users” and, from the parent group list, select All Users, and then click Next.
segment.target: For the Group name, type “My Trial Users” and, from the parent group list, select All Users, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Define Membership Criteria page, set Start group membership with to All users in the Parent group.
segment.target: On the Define Membership Criteria page, set Start group membership with to All users in the Parent group.

segment.source: Beside Exclude members from these security groups, click Browse and then select Company Administrator.
segment.target: Beside Exclude members from these security groups, click Browse and then select Company Administrator.

segment.source: This exclusion lets you manage the My Trial Users group without affecting the Company Administrator account (also known as the tenant administrator).
segment.target: This exclusion lets you manage the My Trial Users group without affecting the Company Administrator account (also known as the tenant administrator).

segment.source: On the Define Direct Membership page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Define Direct Membership page, click Next.

segment.source: You don’t need to do anything here because you want the My Trial Users group to include all users, except for the Company Administrator.
segment.target: You don’t need to do anything here because you want the My Trial Users group to include all users, except for the Company Administrator.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the actions that will be taken, and then click Finish.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the actions that will be taken, and then click Finish.

segment.source: You can find the newly created group in the Groups list, in the Groups workspace under All Users.
segment.target: You can find the newly created group in the Groups list, in the Groups workspace under All Users.

segment.source: From here, you can also edit or delete the group.
segment.target: From here, you can also edit or delete the group.

segment.source: To learn more about using groups, see Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To learn more about using groups, see Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Step 4: Create policies and publish an app
segment.target: Step 4: Create policies and publish an app

segment.source: policies provide settings that help you control the security settings on mobile devices, maintain Windows Firewall and Endpoint Protection settings for computers, and deploy applications.
segment.target: policies provide settings that help you control the security settings on mobile devices, maintain Windows Firewall and Endpoint Protection settings for computers, and deploy applications.

segment.source: If you are planning to use Intune for devices that you configure for production use after the trial, it's absolutely essential that you follow the instructions in Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies and Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: If you are planning to use Intune for devices that you configure for production use after the trial, it's absolutely essential that you follow the instructions in Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies and Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You can perform two types of app installations using Intune.
segment.target: You can perform two types of app installations using Intune.

segment.source: The first is a required install, which automatically deploys the app to managed computers.
segment.target: The first is a required install, which automatically deploys the app to managed computers.

segment.source: The other is an available install, which deploys the app, or a link to the app, to the Intune company portal so that users can choose whether to install it on their computers or on their mobile devices.
segment.target: The other is an available install, which deploys the app, or a link to the app, to the Intune company portal so that users can choose whether to install it on their computers or on their mobile devices.

segment.source: Before using Intune to deploy apps, make sure that you have the appropriate licenses to publish, distribute, and use the app.
segment.target: Before using Intune to deploy apps, make sure that you have the appropriate licenses to publish, distribute, and use the app.

segment.source: The Licenses workspace lets you add and manage license agreement information for apps or software purchased through Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements, and for Microsoft or non-Microsoft apps or software purchased by other means.
segment.target: The Licenses workspace lets you add and manage license agreement information for apps or software purchased through Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements, and for Microsoft or non-Microsoft apps or software purchased by other means.

segment.source: You can then create license reports, which display managed license usage information throughout your company, to stay informed of license usage activity.
segment.target: You can then create license reports, which display managed license usage information throughout your company, to stay informed of license usage activity.

segment.source: In these steps, you'll set up a mobile device configuration policy and a Windows computer firewall policy, and configure Skype as an available install for mobile devices after they're enrolled.
segment.target: In these steps, you'll set up a mobile device configuration policy and a Windows computer firewall policy, and configure Skype as an available install for mobile devices after they're enrolled.

segment.source: After you add and deploy a new policy, all users or devices in the group to which you deployed the policy inherit the settings as their baseline policy.
segment.target: After you add and deploy a new policy, all users or devices in the group to which you deployed the policy inherit the settings as their baseline policy.

segment.source: You can always review and edit the details of these policies later from the Policy workspace in the administration console.
segment.target: You can always review and edit the details of these policies later from the Policy workspace in the administration console.

segment.source: Create and deploy a mobile device configuration policy
segment.target: Create and deploy a mobile device configuration policy

segment.source: Open the Intune administration console.
segment.target: Open the Intune administration console.

segment.source: In the left pane, click the Policy icon.
segment.target: In the left pane, click the Policy icon.

segment.source: In the Tasks list on the Policy Overview page, click Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Tasks list on the Policy Overview page, click Add Policy.

segment.source: In the policy list, expand the platform you want to create a policy for, select General Configuration, choose Create and Deploy a Policy with the Recommended Settings, and then click Create Policy.
segment.target: In the policy list, expand the platform you want to create a policy for, select General Configuration, choose Create and Deploy a Policy with the Recommended Settings, and then click Create Policy.

segment.source: When prompted to Select the groups to which you want to deploy this policy, select My Trial Users from the list, and click Add > OK.
segment.target: When prompted to Select the groups to which you want to deploy this policy, select My Trial Users from the list, and click Add > OK.

segment.source: Your policy appears in the list of configuration policies, and has been deployed to the My Trial Users group.
segment.target: Your policy appears in the list of configuration policies, and has been deployed to the My Trial Users group.

segment.source: Double-click the policy to view its settings.
segment.target: Double-click the policy to view its settings.

segment.source: Publish the Skype app for mobile devices
segment.target: Publish the Skype app for mobile devices

segment.source: In the Intune administration console, click the Apps icon, then click Apps > Add App.
segment.target: In the Intune administration console, click the Apps icon, then click Apps > Add App.

segment.source: If prompted, enter your credentials.
segment.target: If prompted, enter your credentials.

segment.source: When you start the Intune Software Publisher for the first time, a short delay occurs while the application is installed.
segment.target: When you start the Intune Software Publisher for the first time, a short delay occurs while the application is installed.

segment.source: Review the security warning and click Run.
segment.target: Review the security warning and click Run.

segment.source: On the Before you begin page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Before you begin page, click Next.

segment.source: On the Software setup page in Select how this software is made available to devices, select External link.
segment.target: On the Software setup page in Select how this software is made available to devices, select External link.

segment.source: Enter the external link for the software in Specify the URL, and then click Next.
segment.target: Enter the external link for the software in Specify the URL, and then click Next.

segment.source: Make sure that you preface the URL with http://.
segment.target: Make sure that you preface the URL with http://.

segment.source: For the Skype app, use the link below that matches the mobile device platform you're using:
segment.target: For the Skype app, use the link below that matches the mobile device platform you're using:

segment.source: On the Software description page, provide the information that you want users to see in the company portal for the software, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Software description page, provide the information that you want users to see in the company portal for the software, and then click Next.

segment.source: The following settings are available (this example refers to Skype):
segment.target: The following settings are available (this example refers to Skype):

segment.source: Publisher: Enter the name of the publisher, "Microsoft"
segment.target: Publisher: Enter the name of the publisher, "Microsoft"

segment.source: Name: Enter Skype
segment.target: Name: Enter Skype

segment.source: Description: Enter a description for the software, such as Skype communication app
segment.target: Description: Enter a description for the software, such as Skype communication app

segment.source: Category: Select the category that best fits this software, such as Collaboration
segment.target: Category: Select the category that best fits this software, such as Collaboration

segment.source: Display this as a featured app and highlight it in the company portal: Select this option to display the app prominently in the company portal on mobile devices.
segment.target: Display this as a featured app and highlight it in the company portal: Select this option to display the app prominently in the company portal on mobile devices.

segment.source: Icon: (Optional) Choose whether to associate an icon with the software.
segment.target: Icon: (Optional) Choose whether to associate an icon with the software.

segment.source: The maximum icon size is 250 x 250 pixels, but the recommended icon size is 32 x 32 pixels.
segment.target: The maximum icon size is 250 x 250 pixels, but the recommended icon size is 32 x 32 pixels.

segment.source: On the Summary page, verify the software information, and then click Upload.
segment.target: On the Summary page, verify the software information, and then click Upload.

segment.source: Click Close to exit the wizard.
segment.target: Click Close to exit the wizard.

segment.source: In the Intune administration console, click Apps > Apps > Skype > Manage Deployment.
segment.target: In the Intune administration console, click Apps > Apps > Skype > Manage Deployment.

segment.source: On the Select Groups page, select My Trial Users to deploy the software to that user group, and then click Add > Next.
segment.target: On the Select Groups page, select My Trial Users to deploy the software to that user group, and then click Add > Next.

segment.source: On the Deployment Action page, select Available Install from the Approval column for your group.
segment.target: On the Deployment Action page, select Available Install from the Approval column for your group.

segment.source: Click Finish.
segment.target: Click Finish.

segment.source: The Skype app is now available to install on mobile devices from the company portal, but first you need to install software on computers and mobile devices.
segment.target: The Skype app is now available to install on mobile devices from the company portal, but first you need to install software on computers and mobile devices.

segment.source: Step 5: Enroll computers in Intune
segment.target: Step 5: Enroll computers in Intune

segment.source: You can install the client software on computers in the following ways:
segment.target: You can install the client software on computers in the following ways:

segment.source: Users can use an installer provided by the administrator to manually enroll
segment.target: Users can use an installer provided by the administrator to manually enroll

segment.source: software can be included in an OS image, or deployed using Group Policy
segment.target: software can be included in an OS image, or deployed using Group Policy

segment.source: End users can self-enroll their device through the company portal
segment.target: End users can self-enroll their device through the company portal

segment.source: Each enrolled computer is linked to the user account that was used to install the client software.
segment.target: Each enrolled computer is linked to the user account that was used to install the client software.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is also installed by default during Intune client installation on computers.
segment.target: Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is also installed by default during Intune client installation on computers.

segment.source: Endpoint Protection helps to secure computers in your organization by providing real-time protection against potential threats, keeping malicious software definitions up to date, and automatically running scheduled scans.
segment.target: Endpoint Protection helps to secure computers in your organization by providing real-time protection against potential threats, keeping malicious software definitions up to date, and automatically running scheduled scans.

segment.source: For added security, you can also use Intune policies to manage Windows Firewall settings on managed computers.
segment.target: For added security, you can also use Intune policies to manage Windows Firewall settings on managed computers.

segment.source: What to know before you start:
segment.target: What to know before you start:

segment.source: The user must be an administrator on the computer to install the client software.
segment.target: The user must be an administrator on the computer to install the client software.

segment.source: Self-enrolling requires that Internet Explorer is installed on the client computer.
segment.target: Self-enrolling requires that Internet Explorer is installed on the client computer.

segment.source: Each time a user self-enrolls a computer, a license is used
segment.target: Each time a user self-enrolls a computer, a license is used

segment.source: You must use a Microsoft Online Services work or school account to self-enroll a computer.
segment.target: You must use a Microsoft Online Services work or school account to self-enroll a computer.

segment.source: This is the account that you used to sign in, or the administrator account that was created when you signed up for the free trial.
segment.target: This is the account that you used to sign in, or the administrator account that was created when you signed up for the free trial.

segment.source: For this trial, follow these steps, which use the self-enrollment approach:
segment.target: For this trial, follow these steps, which use the self-enrollment approach:

segment.source: In the Intune administration console, click Admin > Company Portal, and then scroll to the bottom of the screen.
segment.target: In the Intune administration console, click Admin > Company Portal, and then scroll to the bottom of the screen.

segment.source: Copy the URL shown under Intune company portal.
segment.target: Copy the URL shown under Intune company portal.

segment.source: Use Internet Explorer to browse to the company portal URL that you acquired in the previous step, and log in with your administrator credentials.
segment.target: Use Internet Explorer to browse to the company portal URL that you acquired in the previous step, and log in with your administrator credentials.

segment.source: Click Add Device.
segment.target: Click Add Device.

segment.source: Click Download Software and then click Run.
segment.target: Click Download Software and then click Run.

segment.source: Click Next to start the Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to start the Setup wizard.

segment.source: When the Setup wizard has completed, click Finish.
segment.target: When the Setup wizard has completed, click Finish.

segment.source: To learn more about computer management using , see Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To learn more about computer management using , see Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: To learn more about software management using , see Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To learn more about software management using , see Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Step 6: Enroll mobile devices and install an app
segment.target: Step 6: Enroll mobile devices and install an app

segment.source: To set up mobile device management with Intune, you must first set the mobile device management authority, enable management for device platforms, and enroll your devices with the company portal app.
segment.target: To set up mobile device management with Intune, you must first set the mobile device management authority, enable management for device platforms, and enroll your devices with the company portal app.

segment.source: You can then deploy the Microsoft Skype application that you published.
segment.target: You can then deploy the Microsoft Skype application that you published.

segment.source: Make Intune your mobile device management authority
segment.target: Make Intune your mobile device management authority

segment.source: In the Intune administration console, click Admin > Mobile Device Management, and click Set MDM Authority under Tasks.
segment.target: In the Intune administration console, click Admin > Mobile Device Management, and click Set MDM Authority under Tasks.

segment.source: Click Yes in the MDM Authority dialog box.
segment.target: Click Yes in the MDM Authority dialog box.

segment.source: Enable MDM for your device platform
segment.target: Enable MDM for your device platform

segment.source: Enable mobile device management for the device platform you want to manage.
segment.target: Enable mobile device management for the device platform you want to manage.

segment.source: Depending on your platform, different requirements are needed:
segment.target: Depending on your platform, different requirements are needed:

segment.source: iOS and Mac OS X: see Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: iOS and Mac OS X: see Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Windows Phone: see Set up Windows Phone management with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Windows Phone: see Set up Windows Phone management with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Android: Android mobile devices allow users to enroll using the company portal app available from Google Play.
segment.target: Android: Android mobile devices allow users to enroll using the company portal app available from Google Play.

segment.source: No additional configuration in Intune is required.
segment.target: No additional configuration in Intune is required.

segment.source: Enroll devices:
segment.target: Enroll devices:

segment.source: Android - Install the Intune Company Portal app from Microsoft Corporation, available on Google Play, and sign in with the Intune user credentials added above.
segment.target: Android - Install the Intune Company Portal app from Microsoft Corporation, available on Google Play, and sign in with the Intune user credentials added above.

segment.source: iOS and Mac OS X - Install the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app from Microsoft Corporation available in the App Store and sign in with Intune user credentials added above.
segment.target: iOS and Mac OS X - Install the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app from Microsoft Corporation available in the App Store and sign in with Intune user credentials added above.

segment.source: View Enrolled devices to add your device.
segment.target: View Enrolled devices to add your device.

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1- Users install the Company Portal app from Microsoft Corporation, available in the Windows Phone store, and sign in with the Intune user credentials added above.
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1- Users install the Company Portal app from Microsoft Corporation, available in the Windows Phone store, and sign in with the Intune user credentials added above.

segment.source: View Enrolled devices to add your device.
segment.target: View Enrolled devices to add your device.

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.0 - Users click system settings > company apps, and sign in with Intune user credentials added above.
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.0 - Users click system settings > company apps, and sign in with Intune user credentials added above.

segment.source: The company portal app is deployed to your phone.
segment.target: The company portal app is deployed to your phone.

segment.source: If prompted for a Server address, type “manage.microsoft.com”.
segment.target: If prompted for a Server address, type “manage.microsoft.com”.

segment.source: Open the company portal on the mobile device, choose Apps, and then install Microsoft Skype.
segment.target: Open the company portal on the mobile device, choose Apps, and then install Microsoft Skype.

segment.source: To learn more about mobile device management using , see Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To learn more about mobile device management using , see Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Intune options and extras
segment.target: Intune options and extras

segment.source: Alerts, notifications and reports
segment.target: Alerts, notifications and reports

segment.source: In the administration console, alerts are used to quickly assess the overall health of managed devices in your organization.
segment.target: In the administration console, alerts are used to quickly assess the overall health of managed devices in your organization.

segment.source: You can configure and customize alerts so that they report and display only the information you need for your organization.
segment.target: You can configure and customize alerts so that they report and display only the information you need for your organization.

segment.source: You can set whether an alert is enabled or disabled, configure the severity, use the display threshold to determine how frequently an alert event must be triggered before an alert is displayed, and also configure settings that are specific to certain types of alerts.
segment.target: You can set whether an alert is enabled or disabled, configure the severity, use the display threshold to determine how frequently an alert event must be triggered before an alert is displayed, and also configure settings that are specific to certain types of alerts.

segment.source: Notifications are emails used to inform administrators (and other users) when certain types of alerts are triggered.
segment.target: Notifications are emails used to inform administrators (and other users) when certain types of alerts are triggered.

segment.source: Reports are used to answer a range of questions, such as how many computers have a particular application or update installed, what malware was blocked, or which users needed Remote Assistance over the last month.
segment.target: Reports are used to answer a range of questions, such as how many computers have a particular application or update installed, what malware was blocked, or which users needed Remote Assistance over the last month.

segment.source: To learn more about alerts, notifications, and reports, see Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To learn more about alerts, notifications, and reports, see Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Intune capabilities
segment.target: Intune capabilities

segment.source: has a wide variety of capabilities beyond those shown in these short setup steps.
segment.target: has a wide variety of capabilities beyond those shown in these short setup steps.

segment.source: A few examples of these capabilities include:
segment.target: A few examples of these capabilities include:

segment.source: Control access to Exchange and Office 365.
segment.target: Control access to Exchange and Office 365.

segment.source: For details, see Manage access to email and SharePoint with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Manage access to email and SharePoint with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Management of corporate-owned iOS devices.
segment.target: Management of corporate-owned iOS devices.

segment.source: For details, see Enroll corporate-owned iOS devices in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Enroll corporate-owned iOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Mobile application management.
segment.target: Mobile application management.

segment.source: Managed mobile apps work with mobile application management policies to restrict certain app operations, such as copy and paste and screenshot functionality.
segment.target: Managed mobile apps work with mobile application management policies to restrict certain app operations, such as copy and paste and screenshot functionality.

segment.source: For details, see Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console and Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console and Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Control access to company resources.
segment.target: Control access to company resources.

segment.source: You can deploy certificates, e-mail profiles, VPN profiles and Wi-Fi profiles to mobile devices, making it easier to quickly set up mobile devices.
segment.target: You can deploy certificates, e-mail profiles, VPN profiles and Wi-Fi profiles to mobile devices, making it easier to quickly set up mobile devices.

segment.source: For details, see Enable access to company resources with Microsoft Intune - deleted.
segment.target: For details, see Enable access to company resources with Microsoft Intune - deleted.

segment.source: To learn about the full capabilities of , see Mobile device management capabilities in Microsoft Intune, Windows PC management capabilities in Microsoft Intune and the Microsoft Intune Service Description.
segment.target: To learn about the full capabilities of , see Mobile device management capabilities in Microsoft Intune, Windows PC management capabilities in Microsoft Intune and the Microsoft Intune Service Description.

segment.source: To learn more about capabilities that were recently introduced to , see What's new in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To learn more about capabilities that were recently introduced to , see What's new in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Support options are described in How to get support for Microsoft Intune, and you can join discussions about in Microsoft Intune forums.
segment.target: Support options are described in How to get support for Microsoft Intune, and you can join discussions about in Microsoft Intune forums.

segment.source: Ready to move to an Intune paid subscription?
segment.target: Ready to move to an Intune paid subscription?

segment.source: If you purchase at least 150 licenses for Microsoft Intune in an eligible plan, you can use the "FastTrack Center Benefit," a service where Microsoft specialists work with you to get your environment ready for Intune.
segment.target: If you purchase at least 150 licenses for Microsoft Intune in an eligible plan, you can use the "FastTrack Center Benefit," a service where Microsoft specialists work with you to get your environment ready for Intune.

segment.source: See Microsoft Intune Service Benefit Description.
segment.target: See Microsoft Intune Service Benefit Description.

segment.source: You can convert your free Intune trial to a paid subscription in the following ways:
segment.target: You can convert your free Intune trial to a paid subscription in the following ways:

segment.source: Intune Subscription - Licensed on a per-user basis.
segment.target: Intune Subscription - Licensed on a per-user basis.

segment.source: For more information, see How to buy Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see How to buy Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: After completing your purchase, follow the steps in Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune and review the additional configuration steps when you're getting started with Intune.
segment.target: After completing your purchase, follow the steps in Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune and review the additional configuration steps when you're getting started with Intune.

segment.source: Enterprise Mobility Suite - Provides , Azure Active Directory Premium, Azure RMS services.
segment.target: Enterprise Mobility Suite - Provides , Azure Active Directory Premium, Azure RMS services.

segment.source: Contact your Microsoft account manager or local reseller for more details, or see information on the Enterprise Mobility Suite or Enterprise Mobility Suite pricing.
segment.target: Contact your Microsoft account manager or local reseller for more details, or see information on the Enterprise Mobility Suite or Enterprise Mobility Suite pricing.

segment.source: Enterprise Agreement (>250 users) - The best licensing program for organizations with more than 250 users.
segment.target: Enterprise Agreement (>250 users) - The best licensing program for organizations with more than 250 users.

segment.source: The EA gives you the flexibility to choose among on-premises software and online services to best suit your user needs and help you optimize your technology spend.
segment.target: The EA gives you the flexibility to choose among on-premises software and online services to best suit your user needs and help you optimize your technology spend.

segment.source: Contact your Microsoft account manager or local reseller for more details, or see the Enterprise Volume Licensing site.
segment.target: Contact your Microsoft account manager or local reseller for more details, or see the Enterprise Volume Licensing site.

segment.source: Online subscription program (<250 users) - Online Services volume licensing program is designed specifically for organizations with less than 250 users.
segment.target: Online subscription program (<250 users) - Online Services volume licensing program is designed specifically for organizations with less than 250 users.

segment.source: Use this program to subscribe, manage, and deploy your services.
segment.target: Use this program to subscribe, manage, and deploy your services.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune
